ygData.msgSnippet: Research is considered a trade skill, so why wouldnt you be able to sell your spells? ... From: Craig Joyner  To:
ygData.messageBody:
Research is considered a trade skill, so why wouldnt you be able to sell
your spells?

----- Original Message -----
From: Craig Joyner <qrentqent@...>
To: <EQ_spell_research@onelist.com>
Sent: Friday, May 14, 1999 7:20 AM
Subject: [EQ_spell_research] Can't cross research other classes spells


> From: "Craig Joyner" <qrentqent@...>
>
> Hallo,
>
> Just to clarify on two points be discussed here:
>
> 1. You can only research spells of your class, this comes from GZ, the
arch
> mage of magick in EQ, so you should accept it as the gospel in regards to
> this question on research.
>
> 2. When you put one point into research at level 16 you actually get 16
> points, that is why you don't see a skill increase for 2-15 because you
are
> already at 16. This only works on a skill you have a zero in, any skill
that
> has a zero gets the # of points = to your current level, so if you get a
new
> langague option that you have a zero skill in you will get an equal amount
> of points equal to your current level, so it's best to wait to level 20 to
> put your points into research/langauges you have zero skill in since
you'll
> get 20 points for your one points instead of 16.
>
> I have no idea if you can research a spell for your class and sell it to
> another member of your class, would be nice to know as I plan to use
> research as money making skill as I know many people see research as a
> headache and would gladly pay a big surcharge so as to avoid learning four
> different languages and searching high and low for components.
>
> qq
